unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost in Rajasthan**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost in Rajasthan**

unnormalised: Namaste readers! Rajasthan, known for its sunny skies and spicy Mirchi Vadas, is making big strides in renewable energy. Dr. Sharma at IIT-Jodhpur is leading a team developing more efficient solar panels, potentially increasing energy output by 15%.
normalised: Namaste readers! Rajasthan, known for its sunny skies and spicy Mirchi Vadas, is making big strides in renewable energy. Doctor Sharma at I I T-Jodhpur is leading a team developing more efficient solar panels, potentially increasing energy output by fifteen percent.

unnormalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation Ltd. (RRECL) just announced a new solar park project near Jaisalmer, spanning over 500 acres. This project aims to generate enough clean energy to power roughly 2 lakh homes! Think of it as switching on a Diwali diya for the entire state, but sustainably!
normalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation Limited (R R E C L) just announced a new solar park project near Jaisalmer, spanning over five hundred acres. This project aims to generate enough clean energy to power roughly two hundred thousand homes! Think of it as switching on a Diwali diya for the entire state, but sustainably!

unnormalised: The estimated investment is around Rs. 2000 crores. This park will also create employment opportunities for locals, ensuring that the benefits reach the ground level. The government aims to reach a target of 300 GW of renewable energy by 2030. So next time you are enjoying your piping hot chai, remember that it might soon be brewed with solar power! Even your AC might be powered by the sun, giving you respite from the heat in an environmentally friendly way. The progress is certainly energizing!
normalised: The estimated investment is around rupee two billion. This park will also create employment opportunities for locals, ensuring that the benefits reach the ground level. The government aims to reach a target of three hundred gigawatt of renewable energy by two thousand and thirty. So next time you are enjoying your piping hot chai, remember that it might soon be brewed with solar power! Even your A C might be powered by the sun, giving you respite from the heat in an environmentally friendly way. The progress is certainly energizing!
